sponsor.partnerMessage: The 2022/23 SoNA season continues! Next Up: "A Very SoNA Christmas" with two showtimes on Dec 10 at Walton Arts Center, presenting a mix of holiday favorites and featuring the SoNA Singers, UA Inspirational Chorale, and soprano Lenora Green. CLICK HERE for tickets and info.

posts.title: Today Is Election Day
posts.content:
It’s Voting Day! If you didn't take advantage of early voting, be sure to get out today and make your voice heard in the 2022 Arkansas General Election.

  • Where to go: Confirm your voter registration online HERE and find a list of locations where you can vote today. 
  • What to know: Brush up on the issues being decided in this election with the 2022 Arkansas Ballot Issue Voter Guide.

Read more about expectations for election night HERE.

posts.title: Broadway Hit Chicago Coming To Walton Arts Center
posts.content:
The Broadway hit Chicago is sure to have audiences roaring like the ‘20s at Walton Arts Center with eight performances this week, Nov 8-13. 

  • All that jazz: After 25 years, Chicago has all the quintessential elements of a Broadway classic: a universal tale of fame and fortune, amazing dancing, and one show-stopper after another. 
  • The razzle-dazzle: Chicago has been honored with six Tony Awards, two Olivier Awards, a Grammy, and is widely recognized from the Academy Award-winning movie adaptation released in 2002. 

It would be a crime to miss it! Get your tickets HERE.

posts.title: Eureka Springs Hosts 75th Annual Ozark Folk Festival
posts.content:
The 75th Annual Ozark Folk Festival returns to Eureka Springs this weekend, Nov 10-12, for three days of incredible regional and national folk music. 

  • Move your feet: The event will include free music and the folk fair each day from 10a-3p at The Auditorium followed by headliner performances for the historic Barefoot Ball in the basement of the Aud. 
  • Folk features: Enjoy amazing music all weekend long including headliners Hot Club of Cowtown, Pokey Lafarge, Shinyribs, Willi Carlisle, and Rachel Ammons.  

Find a schedule of the festival and purchase tickets HERE.

posts.title: Vittoria Industries Moving Headquarters To Bentonville
posts.content:
Vittoria Industries, a bicycle tire and tube manufacturer, is moving its North American headquarters to Bentonville. 

  • Biking buddies: Vittoria will set up offices in the Ledger, the world’s first bikable building. Making a great neighbor, Specialized is opening an experience center in the Ledger as well. 
  • Good neighbors: The company will occupy a 1,250-sq-ft office space as well as a 1,000-sq-ft retail kiosk in the lobby, and Vittoria plans to provide free tire services and tune-ups for every tenant in the building.

Read more about Vittoria’s plans HERE.

posts.title: Internal Medicine Residency Beginning In Fayetteville
posts.content:
UAMS and Washington Regional are joining forces to create a new internal medicine residency program here in NWA. 

  • Welcome: The program will bring eight medical residents to NWA each year as they train to be skilled internists. WRMC has built a brand new 6,000-sq-ft GME Suite to house the residents. 
  • Training: The residency will provide training in clinical reasoning, critical thinking, teaching, research, and health care delivery with a focus on diverse and underserved populations in NWA. 

Read more on the story HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Falalala: Start warming up the pipes for caroling season by planning a holiday party at Big Box Karaoke!*
  • Top dogs: Walmart landed the number one spot in the Kantar PoweRanking’s 2022 report for the 26th time. 
  • Shoot the moon: Tonight a total lunar eclipse will be visible between 5:16-6:41a, the last blood moon we’ll see until 2025. 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
